title: Still under renovations but worthy to see from the outside
text: Keep in mind you are not allowed to enter inside and that you will not find any sculptures. Even though, I think it is worthy to visit because what the Parthenon means in the history of the World.

title: A must see if you go to Athens. I had the privilege to see the sunrise from there!
text: If you love Ancient history and art, even when they are still restoring the area and you have to use your imagination really hard (as mostly you will find no sculptures or details), just the feeling of being in such an iconic place and the beautiful views of the huge city of Athens and its surroundings that you have from there, make it worthy. Go early in the morning to avoid lines and groups!

title: Interesting if you wanna know a bit more about Acropolis history
text: I wish I had the opportunity to take a picture of the only valuable piece that caught my eye, but apart from that, the museum is well organized, all tidy and value for money.

title: The best way to really understand and feel the vibe of Athens. Totally worthy!
text: Katherina is a very knowledgeable guide; kind, caring, informative, flexible. She shared me a lot of interesting facts about the history of Athens and how the city and Greece developed, specially from the mid XIX and the XXth centuries. She was so gentle to share me some advice about must see places to visit after our walking tour and where to eat for trying local typical food in a nice athmosphere. I highly recommend her; it's really value for money!
place: Three hour tour to see the real Athens! Get off the beaten path!
